comments:
Selected a project (PDE, no other projects depend on this one) in workspace, 
called Refactoring/Rename...
The dialog didn't close. Pointed to the log for internal error details.
In log the following exception was registered (and plenty of successing 
exceptions):

Fixed.
The problem occured when the breakpoint (any type of breakpoint) was set on a
type include in an external jar. These types are not associated to a resource.
I replaced in the refactoring code the calls to newType.getResource() by calls
to BreakpointUtils.getBreakpointResource(newType). This method returns the best
resource for the given element (never returns null).

JavaClassPrepareBreakpointTypeChange, JavaExceptionBreakpointTypeChange,
JavaLineBreakpointTypeChange, JavaMethodBreakpointTypeChange,
JavaWatchpointTypeChange - replaced in the calls to newType.getResource() by
calls to BreakpointUtils.getBreakpointResource(newType)
